Package camzup.pfriendly

Class ZImage

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
camzup.pfriendly.ZImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, PConstants
public class ZImage
extends PImage
An extension of PImage, specializing in color gradients and blitting text to an image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int CHECKER_DARK
    Default color for dark checker squares, -11184811 or 1.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int CHECKER_LIGHT
    Default color for light checker squares, -5592406 or 2.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int DEFAULT_ALIGN
    Default horizontal alignment when creating an image from text: PConstants.LEFT, 37.
    static int DEFAULT_KERNING
    Default spacing between characters, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 0.
    static int DEFAULT_LEADING
    Default spacing between lines, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 8.

    Fields inherited from class processing.core.PImage

    ALPHA_MASK, BLUE_MASK, format, GREEN_MASK, height, loaded, parent, pixelDensity, pixelHeight, pixels, pixelWidth, RED_MASK, width

    • adjustContrast

      public static PImage adjustContrast​(PImage source, float fac, PImage target)
      Adjusts the contrast of an image by a factor. Uses the CIE LAB color space. The adjustment factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fac - the contrast factor
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the adjusted image
      See Also:
      Pixels.adjustContrast(int[], float, int[])

    • adjustLch

      Adjusts a source image's colors in CIE LCH. Assigns the results to a target image.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      adjust - the adjustment
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the adjusted image
      See Also:

    • checker

      public static PImage checker​(int count, PImage target)
      Creates a checker pattern in an array of pixels. Uses -11184811 and -5592406 as default colors.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the checker pattern

    • fromText

      public static PImage fromText​(PFont font, java.lang.String text)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet. Defaults to the fill color white.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static PImage fromText​(PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static PImage fromText​(PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and is measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed.

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static PImage fromText​(PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning)

    • fromText

      public static PImage fromText​(PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning, int textAlign)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed. The horizontal text alignment may be either center PConstants.CENTER ( 3 ), right PConstants.RIGHT ( 39 ) or left PConstants.LEFT ( 37 ).

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      textAlign - the horizontal alignment
      Returns:
      the new image

    • gradientConic

      public static PImage gradientConic​(Gradient grd, float xOrig, float yOrig, float radians, Color.AbstrEasing easing, PImage target)
      Generates a conic gradient, where the factor rotates on the z axis around an origin point. Best used with square images; for other aspect ratios, the origin should be adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      xOrig - the origin x coordinate
      yOrig - the origin y coordinate
      radians - the angle in radians
      easing - the easing function
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the conic gradient

      public static PImage gradientLinear​(Gradient grd, Color.AbstrEasing easing, PImage target)

      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the linear gradient

    • gradientRadial

      public static PImage gradientRadial​(Gradient grd, float xOrig, float yOrig, float radius, Color.AbstrEasing easing, PImage target)
      Generates a radial gradient from an origin point. The origin should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. Does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that isn't 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      xOrig - the origin x coordinate
      yOrig - the origin y coordinate
      radius - the radius
      easing - the easing function
      target - the target pixels
      Returns:

    • mirror

      public static PImage mirror​(PImage source, float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, boolean flip, PImage target)
      Mirrors an image across the axis described by an origin and destination. Coordinates are expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Out-of-bounds pixels are omitted from the mirror.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      xOrigin - the origin x
      yOrigin - the origin y
      xDest - the destination x
      yDest - the destination y
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the mirrored image
      See Also:
      Pixels.mirror(int[], int, int, float, float, float, float, boolean, int[])

    • paletteExtract

      public static Color[] paletteExtract​(PImage source, int capacity)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. Colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      Returns:
      the color array

    • paletteExtract

      public static Color[] paletteExtract​(PImage source, int capacity, int threshold)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. The threshold describes the minimum number of unique colors in the image beneath which it is preferable to not engage the octree. Once the octree has been used, colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      threshold - the minimum threshold
      Returns:
      the color array

    • paletteMap

      public static PImage paletteMap​(PImage source, Color[] palette, int capacity, float radius, PImage target)

      Parameters:

      palette - the color palette
      capacity - the octree capacity
      radius - the query radius
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the mapped image
      See Also:
      Pixels.paletteMap(int[], Color[], int, float, int[])

    • resize

      public static PImage resize​(PImage source, int wTrg, int hTrg, PImage target)
      Resizes an image to a target width and height. The arguments are scaled by the image's pixel density within the method. Takes the absolute value of the arguments; does not flip an image based on sign.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      wTrg - the target width
      hTrg - the target height
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the resized image

      the scaled image

    • scaleBilinear

      public static PImage scaleBilinear​(PImage source, float wPrc, float hPrc, PImage target)
      Scales an image by a percentage of its original width and height. Percentages are expected to be within [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      wPrc - the width percentage
      hPrc - the height percentage
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the scaled image
      See Also:
      Utils.round(float)

    • stretchContrast

      public static PImage stretchContrast​(PImage source, float fac, PImage target)
      Finds the minimum, maximum and mean lightness in a source image. If factor is positive, stretches color to maximum lightness range in [0.0, 100.0]. If factor is negative, compresses color to mean. Assigns result to target array. The factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].

      If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fac - the factor
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image
      See Also:
      Pixels.stretchContrast(int[], float, int[])

    • stretchContrast

      public static PImage stretchContrast​(PImage source, PImage target)
      Finds the minimum and maximum lightness in a source image. If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image

      Returns:
      the tinted image

    • unpremul

      public static PImage unpremul​(PImage source, PImage target)
      Divides the red, green and blue channels of each pixel in a source image by the alpha channel. Reverse pre-multiplication.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Pixels.unpremul(int[], int[])

    • wrap

      public static PImage wrap​(PImage source, int dx, int dy, PImage target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Pixels.wrap(int[], int, int, int, int, int, int[])
